Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?

Topic: Law
Context: A shopping center has exactly seven spaces—space 1 through space 7—arranged in a straight row. Seven businesses—an optometrist, a pharmacy, two restaurants, a shoe store, a toy store, and a veterinarian—will be located in the shopping center, one in each space. The locations of the businesses are subject to the following constraints: The pharmacy must be at one end of the row and one of the restaurants at the other. The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses. The pharmacy must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian. The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian.
Question: Which one of the following could be the order of the businesses in spaces 1 through 7 respectively?
Choices:
  A: pharmacy, optometrist, shoe store, restaurant, veterinarian, toy store, restaurant
  B: pharmacy, veterinarian, optometrist, shoe store, restaurant, toy store, restaurant
  C: restaurant, shoe store, veterinarian, pharmacy, optometrist, toy store, restaurant
  D: restaurant, toy store, optometrist, restaurant, veterinarian, shoe store, pharmacy
  E: restaurant, optometrist, toy store, restaurant, shoe store, veterinarian, pharmacy
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
No reflection information provided.

Thought:
The pharmacy must be at one end of the row and one of the restaurants at the other. So, the order must be pharmacy, restaurant, _, _, _, _, restaurant or restaurant, _, _, _, _, _, pharmacy. The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses. So, the order must be pharmacy, restaurant, _, _, _, _, restaurant or restaurant, _, _, _, _, _, pharmacy. The pharmacy must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian. So, the order must be pharmacy, optometrist/veterinarian, restaurant, _, _, _, restaurant or restaurant, _, _, _, veterinarian/optometrist, _, pharmacy. The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian. So, the order must be pharmacy, optometrist, restaurant, _, _, toy store, restaurant or restaurant, toy store, optometrist, _, veterinarian, shoe store, pharmacy. 
Option A: pharmacy, optometrist, shoe store, restaurant, veterinarian, toy store, restaurant - optometrist and veterinarian are not next to the pharmacy.
Option B: pharmacy, veterinarian, optometrist, shoe store, restaurant, toy store, restaurant - the two restaurants are not separated by at least two other businesses.
Option C: restaurant, shoe store, veterinarian, pharmacy, optometrist, toy store, restaurant - the pharmacy is not at one end of the row.
Option D: restaurant, toy store, optometrist, restaurant, veterinarian, shoe store, pharmacy - the pharmacy is not at one end of the row.
Option E: restaurant, optometrist, toy store, restaurant, shoe store, veterinarian, pharmacy - this satisfies all the given constraints.
Action: Answer("E")
